Class LineBorder

java.lang.Object
  LineBorder
All Implemented Interfaces:
Border
 class LineBorder
extends Object
implements Border

A class which implements a simple line border in the color black. See the GUIWorld class for examples of how to use this class.

Version:
1.0 01/05/2011
Author:
Ed Parrish

Constructor Summary
LineBorder()
          Creates a simple line border in the color black and a thickness of one.
LineBorder(Color lineColor, int lineThickness)
          Creates a simple line border with the specified color and thickness.
 
Method Summary
 Insets getBorderInsets()
          Returns a new Insets object where the top, left, bottom, and right fields return the values needed for drawing the border.
 void paintBorder(GUIComponent c, Graphics g)
          Paints the border for the specified component.
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Constructor Detail

LineBorder

public LineBorder()
Creates a simple line border in the color black and a thickness of one.

LineBorder

public LineBorder(Color lineColor,
                  int lineThickness)
Creates a simple line border with the specified color and thickness.

Parameters:
lineColor - The color of the border.
lineThickness - The thickness of the border in pixels.
Method Detail

paintBorder

public void paintBorder(GUIComponent c,
                        Graphics g)
Paints the border for the specified component.

Specified by:
paintBorder in interface Border
Parameters:
c - The component for which this border is being painted.
g - The graphics context in which to paint.

getBorderInsets

public Insets getBorderInsets()
Returns a new Insets object where the top, left, bottom, and right fields return the values needed for drawing the border.

Specified by:
getBorderInsets in interface Border
Returns:
A new Insets object with the required values needed for drawing the border.
